page.title: 15OVERTON HALL
page.content: Overton Hall was the home of Sir Joseph Banks who went round the world with Captain Cook. It is now the home of thirty-five residents whose average age is in the late eighties. There are three resident State Enrolled nurses as well as Matron, domestic staff and gardeners. Only residential care is provided at present. Very ill patients are moved to hospital although short term bed nursing is provided. It is planned to expand and include the care of bed-ridden patients in the near future. A chiropodist, physiotherapist,hair-dresser and the mobile library are among the services provided.
